soc.message
Class MessageTemplateMs

java.lang.Object
  soc.message.Message
      soc.message.MessageMulti
          soc.message.MessageTemplateMs
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
Direct Known Subclasses:
GameOptionInfo, GamesWithOptions
public abstract class MessageTemplateMs
extends MessageMulti

Template for message types with variable number of string parameters. You will have to write parseDataStr, because of its subclass return type and because it's static.

Sample implementation: // format of s: POTENTIALSETTLEMENTS sep game sep2 settlement {sep2 settlement}*... // Must have at least game + 1 settlement param. public static PotentialSettlements parseDataStr(String[] s) { String ga; // the game name String[] sett; // the settlements if ((s == null) || (s.length < 2)) return null; // must have at least game + 1 settlement param ga = s[0]; sett = new String[s.length - 1]; for (int i = 1; i < s.length; ++i) sett[i-1] = s[i]; return new PotentialSettlements(ga, sett); }

For notes on the section you must add to Message.toMsg(String), see MessageMulti.

Author:
Jeremy D Monin
See Also:
Serialized Form
